item.title: Organization of mouse prefrontal cortex subnetwork revealed by spatial single-cell multi-omic analysis of SPIDER-Seq
Evolutionary convergence and divergence of hippocampal cytoarchitecture between rodents and primates revealed by single-cell spatial transcriptomics
Single-cell transcriptome landscape and antigen receptor dynamic during SARS-CoV-2 vaccination
Cross-species single-cell spatial atlas of the hippocampus
item.description:
This study aims to systematically characterize the cellular composition and spatial organization of hippocampal subregions across species. By integrating single-cell spatial transcriptomics and single-nucleus RNA sequencing, high-resolution transcriptomic atlases of the macaque, marmoset, and mouse hippocampus were constructed, enabling cross-species comparisons of cell types and regional organization.

My contribution primarily focused on the integrative analysis of single-cell and spatial transcriptomic data, including cross-dataset cell-type label transfer to assign cellular identities to spatial data, optimization of spatial annotations, and visualization of the results.

item.title: Transport stress induces neuro-immune dysregulation and exacerbates Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection in mice
item.description: This study revealed that transport stress (TS) suppresses immune function and exacerbates Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb) infection. TS induced anxiety-like behaviors, disrupted HPA axis homeostasis, and disturbed hormone secretion and stress-related gene expression. Single-cell RNA sequencing of the spleen showed that TS inhibited Th17 differentiation, IL-17 signaling, and antigen presentation, and interfered with HPA axis–spleen crosstalk via ligand–receptor interactions. As the lead investigator on this project, I independently conducted all data analyses, visualizations, and figure preparation.

item.title: Single-cell Analysis of rAAV-mediated Tumor Pyroptosis
item.description: This study developed a recombinant adeno-associated virus strategy for controllable expression of the N-terminal gasdermin domain and demonstrated that it can induce tumor cell pyroptosis, activate antitumor immunity, and effectively inhibit tumor growth. In this project, I was responsible for single-cell transcriptomic analysis, characterizing the cell types and states associated with rAAV-induced pyroptosis, evaluating the impact of treatment on the tumor immune microenvironment, and generating visualizations to support data interpretation.

item.title: Single-cell Immune Profiling of COVID-19 Vaccination
item.description: This project utilized single-cell transcriptomics and antigen receptor sequencing to systematically characterize the molecular features of immune cells before and after COVID-19 inactivated vaccine administration. We identified a clonal population of CD8⁺ T cells enriched in both vaccinated individuals and COVID-19 patients, which interact with monocytes and dendritic cells to participate in the immune response. I was primarily responsible for the single-cell data analysis, revealing the dynamic states and functional characteristics of key immune cells, providing insights into COVID-19 immune mechanisms and T-cell-based therapies.

item.title: spatialDE-pipeline
item.description: spatialDE-pipeline packages the SpatialDE method, allowing rapid detection of spatially variable genes (SVGs) in spatial transcriptomics data with a single command.

item.title: STAGATE-pipeline
item.description: STAGATE-pipeline is a workflow that packages the existing STAGATE method, enabling rapid computation and visualization of spatial domains in spatial transcriptomics data with a single command.

item.title: Strategies to package recombinant Adeno-Associated Virus expressing the N-terminal gasdermin domain for tumor treatment
Privacy Policy
item.description:
This website is a personal academic homepage.

No personal data are collected, stored, or processed through this website. No cookies or tracking technologies are used.

If you have any questions regarding privacy, please contact me via email.

item.title: Terms
item.description: By accessing and using this website, you agree to comply with these Terms and all applicable laws and regulations.

item.title: 2026-01-02 Paper published in National Science Review
item.description: Our paper Evolutionary convergence and divergence of hippocampal cytoarchitecture between rodents and primates revealed by single-cell spatial transcriptomics has been accepted for publication in National Science Review.

item.title: 2025-04-30 Visiting PhD at UNSW sydney
item.description: During my one-year visiting program at UNSW, I systematically expanded my expertise in epigenomics, becoming proficient in ATAC-seq, ChIP-seq, and CUT&RUN data analysis. I applied multiple approaches to investigate the conservation of regulatory elements across species and explored the application of deep learning in biological data analysis. Throughout this experience, I further strengthened my research collaboration skills and broadened my international academic perspective, laying a solid foundation for the study of complex gene regulatory mechanisms.

item.title: 2022-09-08 Paper published in Genes & Diseases
item.description: Our paper Single-cell transcriptome landscape and antigen receptor dynamic during SARS-CoV-2 vaccination has been accepted for publication in Genes & Diseases.

item.title: 2021-12-09 Paper published in Nature Communications
item.description: Our paper Strategies to package recombinant Adeno-Associated Virus expressing the N-terminal gasdermin domain for tumor treatment has been accepted for publication in Nature Communications.

item.title: Slides
item.description:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy

Wowchemy | Documentation

Features

  • Efficiently write slides in Markdown
  • 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides
  • Supports speaker notes
  • Mobile friendly slides

Controls

  • Next: Right Arrow or Space
  • Previous: Left Arrow
  • Start: Home
  • Finish: End
  • Overview: Esc
  • Speaker notes: S
  • Fullscreen: F
  • Zoom: Alt + Click
  • PDF Export

Code Highlighting

Inline code: variable

Code block:

porridge = "blueberry"
if porridge == "blueberry":
    print("Eating...")

Math

In-line math: $x + y = z$

Block math:

$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$

Fragments

Make content appear incrementally

{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}

Press Space to play!

One Two Three

A fragment can accept two optional parameters:

  • class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS)
  • weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears

Speaker Notes

Add speaker notes to your presentation

{{% speaker_note %}}

- Only the speaker can read these notes
- Press `S` key to view
  {{% /speaker_note %}}

Press the S key to view the speaker notes!

  • Only the speaker can read these notes
  • Press S key to view

Themes

  • black: Black background, white text, blue links (default)
  • white: White background, black text, blue links
  • league: Gray background, white text, blue links
  • beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links
  • sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links
  • night: Black background, thick white text, orange links
  • serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links
  • simple: White background, black text, blue links
  • solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links

Custom Slide

Customize the slide style and background

{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}}
{{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}}
{{< slide class="my-style" >}}

Custom CSS Example

Let’s make headers navy colored.

Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:

.reveal section h1,
.reveal section h2,
.reveal section h3 {
  color: navy;
}

Questions?

Ask

Documentation
